But if the artery is subtle, then wrap it around the extremity of the penis; and cut inside that one a part according to how long are stretched out the extremities of him and they are contracted, lest he does not feel the flow of blood, unless it was inserted.
E aprop evacua del sanc de vi unc. entro a tres.	And take out one unit of blood within three.
E si la arceria es gran, lahoras cove que tu lies aquela en dos locs am fiel dopble fort de ceda o am cordas a lonc, e no coyte a lu putrefaccio denant la consolidacio de la plagua e endevengua flux de sanc.	But if the artery is large, then tie it in two places with strong double thread of cotton or with cords long, and do not cut into it before the consolidation of the disease and find the flow of blood.
E aprop incideys la superfluitat la qual es entre dos liamentz; e fay aquo en aquela hora o aprop autra ora.	And cut into the surplus that is between two ligaments; and do this at that hour or another.
E si vols, cauteriza aquela am cauteri entro al os am cauteri cutellar entro que sian incididas las extramitatz de lu, e stara en loc de aquela meteyssa obra.	If you wish, cauterize it with cautery within the bone and cut a little knife into what is incised on the extremities of him, thus leaving that half-dead work.
E es milhor obra sino que·l malaute aia febre o es de escalfada compleccio; quar cauteri es de aquelas causas que ajudan a las humiditatz finidoras, e donc es milhor en juvament.	It is better to treat an illness without making it fever or hot complication; for the cautery helps with those causes that aid in drying out the humors, and therefore it is better to act quickly.
E cove aprop la extraccio de las arcerias que huomplas le loc de coto antic, e sian pausatz sobre lu polvils decentement fayt, e aprop sia curat am medicinas seccas fazen naysser la carn e am calguas entro que sia sanat.	And cover the removal of the arteries that are made in the same spot as before, and apply poultices on it with powder made decently, and apply oil to the skin so that the flesh is healed and the wound is closed.
E si mentre obres autra veguada endeventa flux de sanc de la arceria, lahora tu te coyta a restrenger aquel sanc, o am cauteri, o que omplas le loc de coto, e strenh la tua ma entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	If while working another wound happens to occur in the same vein, then you must restrain that vein or apply cautery or fill the wound with what fills the hole, and strengthen your hand until the vein is restrained.
E si deguna causa de aquelas no es a tu present, lahoras pausa le tieu dit sobre le loc entro que·l sanc sia congilat, e enbroca le loc am aygua de vehement fregiditat entro que la acuitat repausa, e sia strengut segon que cove.	If no cause among those is at your discretion, then pause yourself on the spot where the vein is constricted, and cover the place with water of great coldness until the wound heals, and strengthen it as much as you can.
E aquo que es pus leugier en extraccio de arceria es que tu cauterizes la vena am aquest cauteri haventz dos cotels, pus que tu has senhat les dos locs am tenta, e depausa quascus, mot ignitz, entro que pervenguan al os e inscindan la vena en dos locs, per so que sia elonguat aquo que es entre las extremitatz de lu, quar no son consolidadas de tot am aquest cauteri.	And what is lighter in extraction of the vein is that you apply cautery to the vein with two cauteries, because you have noticed those two places too carefully, and discard what little sparks are ignited, until they reach the bone and cut the vein into two parts, so that it becomes prolonged as much as possible between his extremities, for which they are not consolidated completely by this cautery.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri:	This is how the cautery is made:
E sia la acuitat dels dos cotels esemps.	And that the sharpness of both knives should be similar.
Mays empero si so mendres acuitat que dos cotels es milhor, quar si so agudas cum dos cotels propera a quascuna freg, e no enscideysso la carn am velocitat.	But if they are sharper than two knives, it is better, for if they are as sharp as two knives, they will pierce the flesh quickly, and not cut it slowly.
Donc cum en aquels es alcuna grossitut, es tenguda la calor del foc en aquels e la carn es abscindida leugierament.	Therefore with those that have no thickness, heat of the fire is kept in them and the flesh is easily cut apart.
E aquesta obra es milhor en tota obra e pus leugiera.	And this work is better than all other works, because it is faster.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre dos cotels la quantitat de la grossesa del dit.	Let the space between two knives be equal to the thickness of that thing.
Capitol quart.	End of Chapter Four.
De la cura de cors de lagremas agudas e aciduas dels huels.	On the treatment of sharp and acid wounds of the body.
Quan so lagremas aciduas, e es le cors de aquelas venas las quals so sobre le test del cap deforo, e no comfereys en aquo alcuna causa de la curacio de medicina, e vezes la cara del malaute ja enrogesir e sent en le sieu front deambulacio ayssi cum si era deambulacio de formiguas, e·ls huels de aquel so extenuatz, humitz enayssi que ja les pels de lor son conodutz, e las parpelas so scalfadas per la acuitat de las lacrimas, les antics agro mesties en la curacio de aquelas de aquesta operacio, e nompnero aquela curacio am spassa. De la cura de lagramas per catartz e als huels descendentz de las partidas dedintz del cap.	From the treatment of ulcers, through cauterization and application of ointments derived from the parts of the head.
Quan ad alcu veno catartz agutz e continuantz, e vezes les huels del malaute extenuatz petitz, e ja le reguardament de lor es debelitat, e las palpebras ulceradas e de lor cazo les pels, e en le preon del cap es dolor aguda ledent e extrenutacio consequent, lahoras sapias per aquestz accidentz que las materias e catartz no veno sino de motas venas de las partidas dedintz procedent.	When it becomes inflamed with ulcers and continues to spread, and often the poultices of the sick weaken small parts, and already the state of weakness has become debilitated, the ulcerated eyelids and from their decay the skin tears, and in the forehead there is sharp and severe pain with consequent inflammation, therefore it is wise for such accidents that materials and ulcers do not appear but from tiny veins of the head's parts.
E la milhor curacio en aquels es aquesta: que comandes al malaute que raza lo sieu front, e aprop inscideys en aquel una fissura al mieg loc del front, un petit per la latitut (e comensa am la fissura del templar senestre entro al dextre templar; e sia inscisio entro al os; e eslongua la tua ma dels lacertz del templas lesquals son maugutz deves la mastigacio), entro que sia le os descubert. Exsicca tot le sanc am espongua o am drap secc e aprop repleys entre las doas labias de la fissura am coto vielh o am draps de li.	Dried whole the stomach is filled with sponge or dry cloth and placed between the two lips of the wound at the old age or cloth.
E aprop estrenh desus am polvils enbegutz en vi e oli per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And place some powder in front of the wound to put on and oil, so that it does not provoke apoplexy.

Capitol .vi.	Chapter VI.
De la cura de aquo que catz en las aurelhas.	Of the cure for what is applied to the ears.
Tota causa que catz en las aurelhas es una de quatre specias, quar o es peyra mineral o causa semblant a peyra, ayssi cum ferr e veyre, o es de planta ayssi cum ceze o fava, o es causa fluxtibla ayssi cum aygua e vi agre e a lor semblantz, o alcuna bestia.	All the cause that is applied to the ears is one of four kinds: either it is a mineral stone or a similar stone, just like iron and vinegar, or it is from a plant, such as thyme or fava, or it is a fluid cause, just like water and vinegar, and to their likeness.
E donc quan peyra catz en l’aurelha o autra causa semblant de aquelas causas que no ajustan ne creysso en l’aurelha, e pausa la aurelha al solelh, e si vezes la peyra, lahoras distilla en aquela alcuna causa de oli violat o sizami, e aprop aministra la extraccio de lu, e fay le stornudar am condizi, e oppila las nars deve le aveniment de stornutacio.	When pain occurs in the ear or another cause similar to those that do not fit or believe in the ear, and pause the ear to the sun, sometimes the pain, then distill in that one cause of oil violating or being like this, and place administration of removal, and make him sneeze with the condition, and observe carefully the signs of sneezing.
E aprop pausa en le circuit de la aurelha alscunas pessas de drap o lana, e dextendas la aurelha a las partidas desus, quar motas veguadas es foro-getada am aquestas causas. And therefore if it is not forgotten by this, then make a cannula of horn and insert the extremity of the cannula into the tract of the ear and close with wax in the interior of the cannula softened with oil so that there be no blockage but the cannula.
E aprop extratz am le tieu vent am fort atraccio, quar tropas veguadas cum aquo que havem recontat.	Appropriate remove the tumor from the inside of the vein, because many times seen with it that has returned.

And therefore if it is not forgotten all the causes that have been mentioned, then it is necessary to cut that immediately in front of you to discover a cauter or spasm.
E la manieyra de talhar aquela es que tu al comensament sancnes le malaute de la vena sephasica e extratz del sanc segon la mannieyra de la vertut de lu, e aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas e converteys l’aurelha a las partidas desus, e fen am petita fissura en la razit de la aurelha deves lo greys de lu en le loc be premegut de lu.	And the way to cut it is that you first sanctify the patient's vein and extract the sinew according to the manner of virtue, and then place that cauter between your fingers and convert the armpit into parts previously, and make a small fissure in the center of the armpit where the grease of him before used.
E sia la fissura de figura lunar entro que pervengua a la peyra, e, la peyra atrobada, osta aquela si podes am instrumentz apropriatz; e aprop cos la fissura en aquela hora am velocitat, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	If there is a crescent-shaped crack in the heel that becomes inflamed, and the heel is swollen, try to put an instrument into it if possible, and fix the crack at that moment with great speed, and cure that place before it gets sick.
E si la causa cazent en la aurelha es un dels gras que creysso e so inflatz, lahoras aministra la curacio e la extraccio de lu; mays si no obezeys a tu ad eyssiment, lahoras tu pren spatum teune subtil segon aquesta forma:	If the cause is a lump in the ear that grows and becomes inflamed, then administer treatment and removal of it; but if you do not obey to your suggestion, then put a subtle substance like this into your ear.
e aministra am aquel la abscizio de aquel gra lo qual es cazut en l’aurelha.	administer the removal of that lump which has fallen into the ear.

Capitol .vii.	Chapter VII.
De curacio de opilacio de aurelhas.	Of treatment for opacification of armpits.
Alcunas veguadas alcus enfantz yeysso dels ventres de lors mayres no-perforatz, e aquo ja accideys en alcus homes, opilacio en le meat de la aurelha per plagua o per carn nada en aquela; e aquesta opilacio alcunas veguadas es fayta en le preon del trau de la aurelha la qual no consiec le vezement, e alcunas veguadas es en las partidas defora.	There are some cases where it is found in the bellies of young girls who do not have perforated wombs, and this happens also in some men, opacification of the meat of the armpit due to plague or no injury at all in that area; and sometimes this opacification occurs on the preon of the armpit tube which is not perceived until the swelling, and sometimes it occurs outside.
E aquela que accideys en le preon de lu, la qual no comprehen le vezement, es en las majors disposicios de dificil sanacio.	The patient will experience a severe case of illness in their groin area, which they cannot comprehend, leading to the most difficult recovery.
E en aquela en qual consegueys le vezement, cove que tu pauses la aurelha del malaute al solelh e reguarda en aquela.	And in that case where they can comprehend the movement, cover your armpit with a cloth and observe in that area.
E donc si vezes oppulacio apparent, obre aquela am espatum subtil del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And therefore if obstruction is apparent, open the small stick under which this lies, as it is the form of it:
Si’ la extremitat de lu en la qual sia petita la latitut, del qual la una partida sia aguda e l’autra no; e le spatum sia de dos latz leon per so que no fassa lizio al aurelha.	If the limb of him in which it is small and has a wide length, where one part is acute and the other not; and the stick is placed with two handles so that it does not disturb the armpit.
E donc si la opilacio es per carn nascuda en la aurelha o en le meat de lu, lahoras te aquela am oncis subtils e incidiys aquela vehement facilitat entro que sia ostada tota la carn.	And therefore if the obstruction is due to a born in the armpit or in the flesh of him, then take that stick and gently pierce it into the softness where it is hidden completely in the flesh.
E si opilacio es en le preon de la aurelha, lahoras pren ray subtil leon e escalfa aquel am foc un pauc, e aprop met aquel en le meat de l’aurelha.	And if the obstruction is in the groin area of the armpit, then take a small stick and heat it up slightly, and place it into the flesh of the armpit.
E donc si as scentit oppulacio am aquo que le malaute atroba am facilitat, per gravetat de ausir, esforsa la oppressio de lu am facilitat; e guarda te que no plagues les nervis del aurelha.	If there is a suffocation of the body where the disease occurs with great difficulty, through the weight of it being difficult to overcome, then exert the force of overcoming it; and be careful not to torture the nerves of the neck.

Mays si accideys flux de sanc, lahoras submergeys esponga o drap en aygua frega e pausa sobre la aurelha, e usa del autra curacio la qual restrengeys le flux del sanc, la qual es dita en le tractat de distillacio.	But if the wound occurs a bloody flux, then submerge a sponge or cloth in water and wipe it over the neck, and use another treatment which restricts the flow of the blood, which is said in the treatise on distillation.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter VIII.
De cura de athezil le qual endeveno a las palpebras.	Healing of atezil which involves the eyelids.
Athezil les quals endeveno a las paupebras dels huels alcuna veguada so humitz, alscunas veguadas son secs.	Atezil which involves the eyelids of the black person have no veins, and sometimes they are dry.

And the best cautery is to insert and apply pressure to those wounds previously opened, when the wound closes again due to lack of any cause for the veins; and when they are cautered with fire, those veins are burned and do not return.
Capitol .ix.	Conclusion.
Cura de grandeyssa que veno a las palpebras dels huels.	Treatment for giantism that affects the eyelids of black people.
Motas veguadas endeve en las palpebras dels huels alcuna causa la qual es asemblada a grandissa en sa fortalicia e duricia, e per so grandissia es apelada. De la cura axcirnah en la palpebra desus del huel.	From the cure of the eyelids above the heel.

Capitol .xi.	Chapter XL.
De manieyras de tactimi del huel.	Of the ways of treating wounds from a blow.
Quan en las palpebras dels huels so natz pels ajustatz dejos les pels naturals e so antiquatz, lahoras aquels noso al huel e fan endevenir manieras de malautias ayssi cum lacrimas assiduas e mollificacio de palpebras e tela entro que aquo sia causa de destruccio del huel que s’apela tactinir del huel, e cura se en quatre manieyras: o per cauteri am foc; o am medicina acuta segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri; o es fayt atactini per inscizio e sutura; o per cannas segon que yeu diyre.	When in the eyelids of the wound there is navel, those parts are tied with natural strings and sealed, in order to stop the flow of liquids such as tears, and to soften the eyelids and the skin inside so that this may cause destruction of the wound that requires treatment of the wound, and cure in four ways: either by applying cauterization with fire; or with sharp medicine according to what is said in the chapter on cauterization; or done with stitches for excision and suture; or by cannas as you have told me.
E donc cove que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se; aprop converteys la palpebra del uelh am la tua ma sinistra, e si es convertida, bo es; e sino, entromet agulha en aquela en la qual sia fiel de la partida pus dejos de la palpebra, e fay penetrar la agulha am fiel desus, e aquo sia — prop del marge de la palpebra en le qual naysso les pels — prop dels pels, e tira le fiel a las partidas desus am la palpebra, e converteys aquela am le ray.	And therefore you should bind the head of the patient with yourself; place the eyelid of the wound with your left hand, and if it is bound, then so is it; and if not, pierce an arrow in that part where it is true from the beginning to the edge of the eyelid, and let the arrow penetrate into the true part above, precisely at the edge of the eyelid, right on the skin, and pull the thread to the parts below at the eyelid, and place it with the ray.

Capitol .xxiv.	The beginning of a medical treatise.

E pus que aquo aura fayt, que atire le sieu odorament entro que pervengua a las canals de las nars, e sia eyssit sobre le sieu golayro, quar tropas veguadas le semblant ad aquesta accio fan les enfantz a las scolas, e es leugiera causa ad aquel que ho vol far.	And if this happens, then apply ointment to the affected area until it reaches the canals of the nose, and cover the nostrils with it, because it's been seen that those who perform such an action are laughed at by children in schools, and it's a very light cause for those who want to do so.
E aprop pausa las dos extramitatz del fiel, una extremitat que iesca sobre le nas et l’autra que romangua en le nas, e aprop aministra serratura de carn am les nuzes que so en le fiel, e fay aquo entro que sapias que las carn ja so am les nuzes del fiel.	Place the two extremities of the finger, one that rises over the nose and the other that remains in the nose, and place a ligature of skin on those fingers that are in the finger, and do this until you know that the skin is already tied to the fingers of the finger.
E aprop extratz le fiel, e pausa en le nas aprop la abstraccio del sanc una calgua , e fay aquo per tres dias o mays entro que l’enguent corrodo tot aquo que es romas de las carns.	Take out the finger, and place it in the nose until there is a certain extraction of pus, and do this for three days or more until the swelling has completely dissolved what remains of the skin.
E aprop en la fi de la causa, pausa en le nas una canula de plom per alscus jorns entro que sia sanat.	Place at the end of the cause, a cannula of lead into the nose for several days until it heals.
Mays si endigeys de curacio que exsique, usa de aquela.	But if it ends in healing that exposes, use that one.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument a capipurge fazedor am le qual son distillatz olis e medicinas en le nars:	And this is the form of the instrument that makes purgation, with which oils and medicines are distilled in the nostrils:
E fay aquo de argent o de eram, la qual sia semblant a una petita lampesa uberta, ayssi cum petita conqua, e le meat semblantment.	And it is made of silver or of horn, which is similar to a small lantern open, in the shape of a small bell, and its meat seems to be.
E si vols, fay una canula clausa ayssi cum cana, e la cancula del estrument a capipurge fazedor e sia plana, descuberta; a la qual sia manubre en lo derier de lu, am le qual tenguas aquela quan escaufas en lu oli o aquo que tu vols dels sucs e de las causas suctiblas.	If you want to, make a closed tube in the form of a cylinder like a pipe, and the instrument's tube cap is made for copious flow and is flat, uncovered; to which it has a thumbhole in its lower part, with which you hold that when you drain oil or water from it, or what you want from the tubular causes.
E aquestz capipurgi es precios: recipe de enforbi de castor, de balayra blanc, de giengiebre, e piletre de safra, de pebre lonc, de escafragia, de epetum de spic ana unc. vi cumfizeys am suc de bleda e de caul, e sian faytas pillulas, e sia destemprada una pillula am aygua tebeza, e sia gitat en las nars del malaute jasent envers.	This purgative is precious: recipe for a castor oil mixture with white vinegar, gingerbread, and powdered saffron, with long pepper, esparto, and spica anthyllis. I combine the blood and cauliflower juice, and make pills from it; and one pill soaked in water should be placed on the sores of the malady facing downwards.
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter XXV.
De theyls natz en las extramitatz del nas.	They should not be applied to the extremities of the nose.
Motas veguadas es nat theyl en las extramitatz del nas, e es magnificat e omentat en alscus dias entro en que mot es leg le reguardament de lu.	Small wounds are suitable for applying the plaster on the extremities of the nose, and it is highly beneficial and accelerated in 8-10 days before a new eruption appears under which this treatment has been taken.
E per aquo cove que tu inscidas aquel en le comensament de la apparissio de lu, e erediques tot aquel.	And therefore cover that in the beginning of its appearance, and eradicate all that.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc o cauteri o medicina comburent la qual estia en loc de lu.	Stop your hand or cautery or medicine that was in its place.
Mays si es tardada la sua inscizio entro que sia magnificat, lahoras considera si es lapificat, dur, de fusca color e de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr quar es apostema crancos; quar motas veguadas ad aquel que inscideys aquesta apostema endeve per lu granda malicia sobre aquel le qual aquel havia.	But if the opening is delayed until it becomes inflamed, then consider whether it is created, is hard, of yellow color and has little feeling; do not touch that place with iron when there is an apestema crusty; for seen wounds at those places which are opened into this apostema endue you great malice upon him who had opened it previously.
E si le apostema es de leon tocament e no es de fosca color, e vezes que inscizio es possibla en tot aquel, lahoras evacua le malaute e inscideys aquel senes temor, e cura le loc am aquo que exsique e costrenh entro que sia sanat.	But if the apestema is of lion's touch and not of yellow color, whenever the opening is possible in all that place, then evacuate the illness and open it without fear, and cure the place with that which excites and constrain it into being healthy.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter XXVI.
De sutura del nas e de las labias e de la aurelha quan la continuitat es dissolvuda per plagua o per semblantz.	Of the suture of the nose and lips, and of the earlobe when continuity is dissolved by plague or by similitude.
Sapias que quan accideys solucio de continuitat en una de aquestas cartillages, pauc confereys en aquela operacio sino en alcus homes.	Know that when a solution of continuity occurs in one of these cartilages, you should not entrust the operation to just any person, but rather only to skilled hands.
Donc cove, quan endeve ad alcu alcuna causa de aquelas, que consideres si es plagua fresca am le sieu sanc, e lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	When the wound is fresh and there are no other causes of that condition, consider whether it has its source in the patient's health, and then adjust both lips of the wound with suture, and appropriate treatment to be done inside so that healing occurs.
E si las labias de solucio de continuitat so ja separadas, e quascuna es fayta sana, lahoras cove que tu excorjes quascuna partida de la sua codena apparent entro que n’iesca sanc.	If the lips of solution and continuity are already separated, and some part is still sane, then cover that which you excise from its chain before it emerges healthy.
E aprop ajusta las doas labias am sutura e strenh aquelas, e sobre aquelas pulveriza sanc de drago e enses trissat, e pausa sobre la polvera una pessa de emplaustra diafinicon, o de alcu autre dels emplastres consolidatius, e leyssa aquel liat per dos jorns o per tres, e aprop deslia aquel e permuta aquel emplaustre e leyssa aquel entro que·ls fiels per si sian abscinditz, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And appropriate to join the two lips with suture and strengthen those, and over that sprinkle healthy salve of dragon blood and apply well-cushioned plaster, or any other consolidated plasters, and let rest on the powder for a few days or three, and then untie that and replace that plaster and let it heal within itself, if it be whole again, and appropriate treatment with ointment until it is healed.
Mays la manieyra de la sutura es que tu agregues la solucio de continuitat o am agulhas ayssi cum havem recomtat en la sutura del ventre, o agregua la solucio de continuitat am fiel ayssi cum a tu e fayt saber.	The method of suture is that you add the solution of continuity or with a needle as they have recounted in the suture of the belly, or add the solution of continuity with thread similarly as if you yourself knew.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter XXVII.
De extraccio de aquela causas que veno en las doas labias en las partidas dedintz.	Removal of those causes that arise in both labia on the divided parts of the rectum.
Motas veguadas endeve a motz homes en las partidas dedintz de las suas labias alcus apostemas durs semblantz a gras de errs, e alscunas de lors son mendres e alcunas son majors.	Small growths that appear in the parts of the rectum on both sides of the vulva, some are soft and resemble millet grains, while others are harder and larger.
Donc cove que tu convertas las labias e fendas quascuna de aquelas duricias de tota part, e aprop la abscizio umpliscas le loc de sagi trissat entro que·l sanc sia restrengut, e aprop sia lavat am vi agre e sia curat le loc am aquo que es stipticitat, entro que sia sanat.	Then cover all the labia and fissures of each one with soft cloth in that place while the sac is restricted, and clean it with vinegar and cure the location where it is infected, until it is healed.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter XXVIII.
De inscizio de la carn ajustada en las gengivas.	Of the incision of the tight skin on the gums.
Granre de veguadas nays sobre la gengiva carn ajustada la qual les antics apelero albulus, adonc cove que tu suspendas aquela am onci o que tenguas aquela am las forfecs e inscidas aquela deves la sua razit, e leyssas la sania correr o le sanc.	When gashes or wounds appear on the tight skin of the gums, which were previously called "albulus", then cover that area with a cloth or tie it up tightly so that the wound does not open up further, and let healing take its course.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc sagi trissat o autra polveras stipticas o excicativas.	And place a poultice or powder on the location that is being wrapped, or another antiseptic or caustic.
E si aquela carn retorna, lahoras inscideys aquela segundariament, e cauterisa aquela, quar aprop le cauteri no retornara.	If that skin returns, then you will inscribe it secondarily, and cauterize it, because the cauterization will not return.
Capitol .xxix.	Of the 29 chapters.
De razo de dentz am ferr.	On the reason of teeth and iron.
Quan en la superficia de las dentz de las partidas dedintz e de las de foro e entre las gingivas so ajustadas escorsas aspras, legas, e alcunas veguadas son de nigradas e son faytas citrinas o vertz entro que a la gingiva ve per aquo corrupcio e son faytas las dentz legas.	When on the surface of the teeth in front of the split teeth and those that have foramen, and between the gums there are scratches, cuts, cracks, and sometimes they are blackened, and this is caused by citrus or yellow vertigo into which the gum veers through this corruption, it causes leg pain.
E donc cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute entre las tuas mas e pausar le cap de lu en le tieu se, e ratz las dents en las quals apareysso aquelas escorsas e causas semblantz arena entro que de lor no romangua deguna causa, e aquo fay de la negror e de la citrinitat e de las autras entro que sian mondificadas.	Therefore cover that you make, sew the wound between your hands and place its head on your hand, rathe the teeth in which those scratches appear, and let them be so that no cause damages it, because of blackness and citrus and other things that are removed.
Donc si es ostat aquo que es en aquelas del comensament de la razio, bo es; e sino, lahoras tu itera la razio sobre aquelas al autra dia e al segon e al tertz entro que vengua al derier stament en aquo que tu vols.	So if it is in that place at the beginning of the reason, then it is; otherwise, inscribe the reason over those on another day and on the second and on the third, until you come to the final statement, as you wish.
E sapias que las dentz han necessitat de motz rezoris de diversas formas e de motas figuras segon que es preparat a la tua operacio.	I have opened the space between the patient's thighs, placed a cushion under them, another servant on their legs, and another on their chest, holding their hands.
E per so quar le razori am le qual la dent es raza de la partida dedintz es autre del razori am le qual es ras entre las dentz segon autras formas, e aquestas formas de razoris sian deves tu preparadas las quals veyras tantost:	And therefore because the razor to which the tooth has been separated from its root is different from the razor with which it was cut between the teeth in other forms, and those forms of razors must be prepared by you which you will see soon:
Capitol .xxx.	The procedure has begun.
D’eradicacio de dentz.	Extraction of teeth.
Cove que tu cures la dent de la sua dolor am tot engen e tardes en tota eradicacio de lu, quar no es denguna causa que suplisqua la veguada de lu quan es eradicada, quar es sustancia sublima entro que es excusacio en la eradicacio de lu.	So that you cure the tooth with its pain and all the engorgement and inflammation in all extraction of it, because there is no cause that justifies the previous condition when it is extracted, for it is a sublima substance inside that excuses the extraction of it.
Mays cove quan le malaute es forsat aquela dent eradicar, que fermament deves tu sia certificat quala es la dent dolent, quar motas veguadas la dolor descep le malaute e cuga que sia en dent sana, e tu eradicas aquela e aprop la dolor no cessa entro que la dent malauta e dolent sia eradicada, quar nos ja havem vist aquo per operacio dels barbies.	But if the disease is strong enough to force that tooth be extracted, then certainly you must be certain that it is the diseased tooth that needs to be removed, because many times the pain ceases after the tooth is removed and it is a healthy one, and you extract it so that the pain does not cease until the diseased and sick tooth is removed, as we have seen before for operations of barbers.
Donc cum deves tu es sertificat qual es la dent dolent, e que o sabes be, lahoras cove que tu scarifiques en le circuit de la dent am spatum en le qual sia alcuna vertut, entro que sia dissolvut de la dent de la gingiva de tota partida, e aprop mau aquel am les tieus ditz, o am forfexs subtils al comensament petit a petit entro que aquela concucesquas.	When you know what ails the tooth and if it can be scraped in the circuit of the tooth with a spatum until it is dissolved from the gum, and before it has completely fallen out, place the same on your tongue or soft fumigations at the beginning small by small until that comes to pass.
E aprop alogua en lu fortz tenalhas grans per bona loquacio o estuptura fort, e pausa le cap del malaute entre les tieus denolhs que be le tengues que no·s maugua, e aprop tratz la dent segon rectitut en manieyra que no trenques aquela, ni al malaute major dolor no dones.	And place a strong talisman or talon in good voice or estupure fort, and pause the patient's head between your hands that hold the pain, and treat the tooth according to right manner so as not to injure it, nor give more pain to the disease.
E donc si no es foro-getat, lahoras pren un de aquels instrumentz, e met aquel dejos lu de tota part am facilitat e esforsa la remocio de lu ayssi que es feyt al comensament.	And therefore if you have not forgotten, then take one of those instruments and place it on that affected part with ease and force to make the removal as is done at the beginning.
Mays si la dent es trauquada o corrosa, lahoras cove que tu comples de drap aquel trauc e estrenguas aquel am la extremitat de ray subtil per so que no sia trinquada en la hora de la tua constriccio sobre aquela am tenalas.	But if the tooth is troubled or corroded, then know that you must complete of cloth that trap and tighten that one at the extremity of the root subtle so that it does not break in the hour of your compression over that one with talons.
E cove que tu obres exquesitament am scarificacio en le circuit de tota part de la gingiva e guarda mot la tua fortaleza que no trenques aquela e romangua partida de lu, e retorne sobre le malaute per la malicia que sia majo que la primieyra dolor de lu.	It appears to be describing a procedure for treating gout. 
E guarda te que no fassas aquo que fan alscus ignorantz barbiers en lor fistinacio e audacia sobre la eradicacio de lor, ses que no aministran aquo que nos havem recomtat; quar motas veguadas fan venir sobre les homes malautias grans las quals son pus dificils que sian trinquadas, e las razitz de lor remaugudas totas, o alcunas de aquelas, o que extrayguas aquela am alcus osses de la mandigula ayssi cum motas veguadas havem testificat.	The translation is:
E aprop la eradicacio de lu sia lavada la boca am vi caut o vi agre am sal.	Remove the infection from him by washing his mouth with vinegar or wine.
E si endeve fluxs de sanc per aysso, ayssi cum motas veguadas endeve, lahoras trissa alcuna quantitat de zegi e aspergeys sobre la plagua, e si no confereys aquel zegi, cauteriza.	If the flow of blood is found for that, so that you may see the motion of the fluxes found there, then sprinkle some quantity of powder and apply it to the wound, if it does not take effect, cautery.
La forma de las forceps e tenalas subtils am las quals es mauguda la dent al comensament sia de longua extramitat, de breu manubre e gros, per so que no sian doblatz quan am aquels deves obrar.	The form of the forceps should be made with handles that are subtle and delicate enough to hold the tooth at its beginning stage - being both long, slender, and thick, in order not to bend when grasping.
E sian ayssi cum vezes de gros manubre entro que quan estrenhas am aquelas no sian dobladas, sian breus extramitatz.	They are such as when they have the thick handle inside that at first they are not bent, but become thinner.
E sian faytas de ferr de India descentment faytas de dreytas extramitatz, e en las extramitatz de aquelas sian dentz de las quals las unas intron en las autras e estrenhan per constriccio descent fort, e alscunas veguadas las extramitatz de aquelas sian la forma del bec d’un auzel le qual ha nom ciconia, so es guanta, e son de fort constriccio.	They are made of Indian iron, with fine details, and in the fine details there are teeth from which one is inserted into another, and new ones are made by binding strong enough, and sometimes the fine details resemble the beak of a swan, known as cicoria, and they have great binding power.
Capitol .xxxi.	End of section XXXI.
De erradicacio de dentz e d‘estraccio dels osses de las mandibulas trincadas.	Removal of teeth and extraction of bones from the locked jaws.
Quan deves la eradicacio de dent le qual es trinquat roman alcuna causa, lahoras cove que tu pauses sobre le loc coto am boder per un jorn o per dos entro que·l loc sia mollificat; e aprop entromet algesti o tenalhas las extramitatz de las quals so asembladas al bec de un auzel apelat ciconia o guanta, la forma de las forceps:	When you want to remove a tooth that is locked without any cause, pause for an hour or two over the area where it touches against the bone to soften; and then insert gentle pressure or use tweezers on the edges of those which are joined to the beak of a bird called cicione or guanta, the shape of the forceps.
Las extramitatz de lor sian faytas dedintz ayssi cum lima o alfagi.	The edges of them are like those of a knife for cutting as sharp as a lime or apple.
E si no obediys a tu a eyssiment am aquestas forceps o tenalas, lahoras cove que tu caves sobre la razit e descrobas tota la carn e entrometas le instrument le qual ha nom atali, so es palanca petita del qual la forma es aquesta:	If it does not obey to your insertion using these forceps or tweezers, pause and then carefully dig into the skin and remove all the flesh until you enter the instrument that has no name, which is a small lever with this shape.
E sia de breu extremitat grossa un petit, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	And it should be a short little finger large one, and not being burnt for so that it does not get locked.
Donc si per aquo la razit es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, ajuda te am aquestz autres instrument dels quals aquestas son las formas: la forma del primier instrument es de triangulada extramitat en la qual sia alcuna grossesa:	Then if by this the skin is forgotten, it is well; and if not, help me with these other instruments of which that one is the shape: the first instrument has a triangular edge in which there should be some size.
La forma del segon instrument es que sia de triangulada e de pus subtil extremitat.	The shape of the second instrument should be triangular, and it has a subtle protrusion at the tip.
E ja so ajudatz am aquest instrument havent dos ramps del qual aquesta es la forma aprop la seguent:	And now you will hold this instrument with two handles, and this is the shape of which it should be approached.
e am autres instrumentz les quals precidero en rasura de dentz; quar juvament es fayt am aquest instrument le qual es asemblat a onci gran, e aquesta es la forma:	And there are other instruments that require shaving of teeth; just now this one is made with a large stone, and this is its shape.
de la triangulada extremitat torta o curta, la qual sia alcuna grossesa, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	The triangular extremity turned or shortened should be some size, and not being nailed down so that it does not break.
E otra sapias que·ls instrumentz de las dentz motz so e semblantment les autres instruments.	And other sages know that these instruments for teeth are similar to the other instruments.
Mays le artifexs savi e subtil en l’art, atroba per si mateys segon aquo que a lu significa la operacio e las malautias diversas; quar son de las malautias a las quals les antics no diysero ni pausero propri instrument, per las formas de diversas specias.	But the craftsman is wise and subtle in this art, if he knows to himself what it means for the operation and various diseases; because those of the old did not know nor was aware of a proper instrument for each of these different kinds.
Mays si es trinquat l’os de la mandibula o dels autres osses de la boca, o si poyreys, lahoras sia pes curat sobre aquel en son loc am aquo que es a lu convenient dels instrumentz e de las forceps las quals havem dit en la extraccio de las razitz de las dentz, e ajuda te am gesti del qual aquesta es la forma:	But if the bone of the jaw or other bones of the mouth is fractured, or if you pour, then put care over that in its place where it is convenient for the instruments and forceps which have been mentioned in the extraction of teeth, and help with this gesture which is its shape:
E sia en lu alcuna grosseza petit a petit, e sia instringida o tenguda am la boca per que no evasesca o fuga entro que l’os de tot sia foro-getat; e aprop restaura le loc am medicinas convenientz ad aquo.	It is in any size, small or large, and whether it is contracted or kept closed so that it does not escape or run inside until all the bones are forgotten; and return the location with suitable medicines to this.
Mays si en l’os es petita poyredura, lahoras ratz aquel de aquela poyredura e de la sua negror, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Even if it is in the bone a small pus, then remove that pus and its darkness, and cure that until it is healthy.
Capitol .xxxii.	Capítulo 32.
De la cura de las dentz eminentz sobre las autras.	Of the treatment of the most important teeth, other than those.
Quan las dentz so eminentz no segon lor cors natural per aquelas la forma es laga, e majorment quan endeve a las femnas, e majorment a las piuselas venerablas; donc cove que tu consideras: si dent es nada aprop autra dent, e no es possibla sarradura ni linament de lu, lahoras radica aquela; mays que no sia annexa am autra dent, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am aquest instrument del qual aquesta es la forma; e es semblant a morr de porc, e sia feyt de ferr de India de extramitat mot aguda.	When the teeth are most important and do not follow their natural form, and especially when they are in the mouths of women, and especially on the lower front teeth; therefore consider this: if a tooth is not attached to another tooth, and there is no possibility of suture or ligament from it, then extract that one; but if it's not attached to another tooth, then inscribe that with the aforementioned instrument, in a similar shape to that of pork, made from iron from India, with sharp edges.
E sia la tua inscizio am la qual inscideyses aquela en trops dias per la duricia de la dent, e que no sia comauguda autra de las dentz.	And be your inscription on the surface where you inscribe that in three days due to the hardness of the tooth, and if it's not worn away like any other teeth.
E si es dent eminent expausat a limadura, lahoras lima aquel am lima de ferr de India del qual aquesta es la forma:	If it is necessary to expose the bone to the surface, then do so with a lime made from Indian iron ore of this form:
E sia tot de ferr de India e·l margua eysament; e sia de motz menutz puntz ayssi cum lima am la qual son faytas agulhas, am la qual la dent sia limada pauc a pauc en motz dias am fecilitat, per so que no sia autra dent comauguda e caga.	It should be all iron from India and the mortar equally; if it is mixed with powdered metal, put points on it like a lime in which needles are made, with which the tooth is smoothed little by little in powder days with facility, so that there be no other tooth molder.
E aprop lineys aquela en la fi, e ratz aquela am alscus razoris.	Then bind it at the end and tie it with those sharp scissors.
E si es dent del qual una partida es trinquada e lideys la lengua, lahoras cove que tu limescas aquel entro que l’aspretat de aquela fraccio sia ostada e engualhada, e sia aplenada per so que la lengua no ledesca ni la paraula no corrumpa.	If a tooth has been partially broken and the edge cuts the tongue, then cover that within yourself so that the edge of that part is smoothed out and hidden, and it is filled in so that the tongue does not hurt nor does the word corrupt.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter xxxiii.
De restauracio de dentz maugudas am fiel de aur o de argent.	On the restoration of mauled teeth with gold or silver wire.
Quan accideys a las dentz devant concussio e remossio per percussio o per cazament, e le malaute no pot strenher sobre aquo que manga, e tu has curat aquel am medicinas stipticas, e no ha valgut la tua curacio, lahoras per so que no cagan es engen en aquelas que sian strengudas am fiel de aur e no de argent, quar argent se fa vert e aprop se poyreys aprop alscus dias, mays aur nul temps no es mudat.	When accidents happen to the teeth in front of concussion and removal by percussion or by falling, and the illness cannot be strengthened over that which is wounded, and you have treated it with topical medicines, and it has not been effective, then for so that they do not decay, they are fixed with gold wire rather than silver, because silver turns green and will rot after a few days, while gold takes no time to change.
E sia le fiel en tal subtilitat e grocesa segon la quantitat que puesca entrar entre las dentz; e la forma de la reccio es que prenguas le fiel e pren lo doble de lu entre doas dentz sanas, e aprop que cresques am doas tortuositatz del fiel entre doas maugudas, o si’ una o motas, entro que pervengua la tela a la dent sana del autra partida.	It is the skill in such subtlety and complexity according to the quantity that can enter between the teeth; and the form of the reed is that you take the reed and pull it twice as much between two healthy teeth, and place so that the creases grow between the twisted reeds on either side, or if there are one or more, until the thread reaches the healthy tooth on the other side.
E aprop itera le teyssiment entro a la partida de la qual comenciest, e strenh la tua ma am facilitat e savieza entro que no sia mauguda.	Return the thread into the part from which you started, and stretch your hand with ease and skill so that it is not twisted.
E sia la tua striccio am la qual strenhas le fiel deves las razitz de las dentz que no evasesca.	It is your tightness by which you stretch the reed so that it does not break because of the teeth.
E aprop inscindeys las extramitatz del fiel superfluens am las forceps o tosoyras, e agregua aquelas en quascun loc am gesti, e converteys aquelas e las occulta entre la dent sana e la dent mauguda, per so que no fassa lesio a la lengua. Quan es medicada sanguisugua am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la curacio am medicinas e no comfereys, considera lahoras en le guolayro del malaute al solelh, pus que tu aias compremuda la lengua de lu am instrument le qual a tu havem recomtat. De castracio.	On Castration.
Sapias que castratio en nostre ley es excomengada, mays per causa es legut a mi que·m remembre de lu en aquest libre; e no es necessaria la rememoracio de lu sino per doas manieyras, de las quals es la una per so que aquo sia en la sciensa del metge quan es enterroguat de aquela, que sapia la curacio de lu al qual accideys; e l’autra manieyra es que nos motas vetz havem necessitat de castracio de autras bestias per les juvamentz nostres per aquelas, ayssi cum de motos, e de bocs, e de porcs, e de semblantz a las bestias.	Be aware that castration is forbidden by law, but it's done for reasons I recall in this book; and it's not necessary to remember it here, except for two ways. One way is so that when the doctor is asked about it, he knows the cure for such cases; and the other way is that we often need castration of other animals for our young ones, just like calves, pigs, and boars, in order to make them similar to us.
E donc dic que castracio es fayta en dos manieyras: o per atrissio, o per fissura a seccio.	Castration is performed in two ways: by slicing or by splitting.
Mays en aquela que es fayta per atrissio, la via de la opera es que nos fassam cezer la bestia en aygua cauda entro que·ls genetius de lu sian mollificatz e sian linhitz e que pendan.	In the case where it is done by slicing, the way of the operation is that we make a cut in the animal into cold water while the genitals are softened and loosened so they hang.
E aprop pren aquels am la tua ma entro que sian resols e no apparescan dejos le tocament.	And take them away from your hand into which they should be wrapped so that they do not come out and are no longer touched.
Mays en castracio fayta per fissura e seccio, cove que tu tenguas la bestia e premas la codena dels testicols de lu am la ma senestra.	But in the case of cutting and splitting, it is so that you have the animal and press the cord of its testicles with your right hand.
E aprop lia le suspensori, e inscideys sobre quascun huou am una seccio entro que dos huous proceseysso.	And tie the suspender to it, and insert a needle into any opening in a way that two openings process.
E aprop inscideys aquels pus que auras quascu excorjat.	And insert those needles where you will find some excoriations.
E no leysses sobre aquels del ciphac alcuna causa, sino le ciphac subtil le qual es sobre les vazes.	And do not look at those of the phallus any cause, but rather the subtle phallus that is on the thighs.

This method of castration is better the one done by slicing, because slicing brings a light and gentle touch to the testicles, so that the animal does not desire coition.

Mays de veruca es eminencia petita aspre fistulada redonda sobre la superficia del cos, e motas veguadas veno en las mas dels enfantz.	The warts are small hard rounded protuberances on the surface of the body, and spots can be seen in many of children.
E curacio de lu es que estendas e inscidas aquela, o que estrenhas aquela am fiel o am pel entro que caja.	The cure for this is to stretch and insert it, or to pin that on the nail, or sewed in by thread or by skin that fits into the crack.

Mays formica es eminencia petita feutrada o fistulada grossa sobre la superficia del cos anant mot en le preon, e quan le freg atroba aquela es centit en lu semblant de mordificacio de formigua, e es fayta entorn le cos. E si vols, fay aquo am canula de eram o de ferr segon aquesta forma:	If you wish, perform this operation with a tube of wool or iron in that form:

De forma dels instrumentz que so aministratz a dar cristeri.	In the form of the instruments that are administered to give stitches.

La forma de cristeri gran e pauc:	The large stitch form is few.
Le cap de la canula de lu desus en le qual es liada la borsa sia ampla segon aquesta manieyra; e sia a lu distinacio la on la borsa es liada ayssi cum vezes. De curacio de las plaguas.	Of the treatment of wounds.
Yeu ja e dit en la divisio de la curacio de las plaguas aquo que convenia al libre, e yeu dic assi la curacio de aquelas am ma e am medicinas segon le conpliment.	And you said in the division of the treatment of wounds that it was beneficial for the free man, and I say so also the cure of those with my hands and with medicine according to its complement.
Donc dic que las plaguas son diversificadas segon aquo en que son faytas las plaguas e segon le loc sobre le qual cazo las plaquas.	Then I say that wounds are diverse according to how they fall, whether on the face or elsewhere.
E las causas per que motas vetz son faytas las plaguas so ayssi cum getament de peyra, o inscisio d’espaza o de cotel, o percussio am lansa, o am fustz, o am sageta, o semblantz ad aquels de motas causas. E yeu so recomtant la curacio de alcunas plaguas per que pauses aquela ratiocinacio e regla sobre las autras plaguas.	And I recommend the cure of certain diseases, in order to put aside that reasoning and rule over other diseases.
E yeu comensare de las plaguas del cap simplas, quar la rememoracio de las compostas vindra al comensament del tertz capitol.	And I will start with the diseases of the head that are simple, because the memory of certain compounds will come to the beginning of the third chapter.
Donc dic que quan accideys en le cap plagua simpla e no es fractura, lahoras considera: si es per getament de peyra o de semblant, e ja ha trinquada la codena tant solament e es gran plagla e temes sobre aquel malaute havinement de apostema caut, lahoras tu te coyta e fleubotoma la cephalica tantost, e no tardas aquo; e extrats ad aquel del sanc segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu si no mes alcuna causa prohibent de fleubotomia, majorment si·l sanc que es eyssit de la plagua es pauc.	So, when it happens in the head that is a simple plague and not a fracture, therefore consider: if it's due to a stone or similar, and has already broken down the tendon only, and it's a great plague and fears about that serious illness of apoplexy, therefore you cut and cauterize the head immediately, and don't delay; and extract according to the standard for the amount of the virtue of him if there is no other cause prohibiting fluebotomy, more so if the remedy that is suitable from the plague is little.
E sia la flaubotomia del contrari de la partida plaguada; e guardase le malaute de replecio e de vi e de viandas grossas.	And it is the opposite of the plague that fluebotomy, and keep the patient from excessive eating and drinking and gross food.
Mays si de la minuicio prohibeys alcuna causa, lahoras sia aminorat de la vianda e no apropinque a carn ni a vi.	But if there is no small cause, then it should be reduced of food and not approach flesh or meat.
E pausa sobre la plagua, si a lu accideys apostema caut, coto enfus en oli rozat solet o en vi en le qual es stipticat.	Pause over the plague, if it happens that an apoplexy occurs with cauterized wound, filled with oil or rosewater or in which it is infected.
Mays si est segur de apostema caut, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua, si es recent am le sieu sanc e le ayre no ha mudat aquela la polvera la qual yeu recomtare aprop petit.	But if it is certain of an apoplexy with cauterized wound, then pause over the plague, if it is recent on their skin and the air has not changed that powder which I recommended to apply little.
E si le ayre ja ha mudada aquela, lahoras pausa sobre alscus enguentz entro que sia sanada.	And if the air has already changed that one, then pause on a cough into which it is until it is healed.
Mays si la plagua es gran o es per inscizio d’espaza e de semblantz, e no so ajustadas las labias de lu per puvils, lahoras ajusta aquelas am sutura segon que yeu recomtare de la sutura de lor.	But if the plague is great or due to space and likeness, and the lips are not closed for ulcers, then close those with suture according to what I recommended about their suture.
Mays si la plagua ja es discuberta del os e pen, e no es retencio de lu sino un petit suspensori, lahoras inscideys aquela e aprop cura la plagua am medicinas e restaura la carn aprop en loc de codena, e comanda al malaute que sia pescut de viandas en las quals es groceza: caps e formen coyt e semblantz a lor, entro que sia compost.	But if the plague has already been discovered of bone and skin, and not retention of him but a small suspender, then opens that one and applies care to the plague with medicines and restores the flesh in place of corded, and commands the sick person to be fed with foods in which is grossness: capsules and form to their likeness, until it is composed.
E si atrobas en la codena putrefaccio e no adhereys al os, lahoras tu inscideys tot aquo poyrit e geta aquo, e aprop cura aquo.	If you see corruption in the codon (presumably referring to the spine or backbone), and it does not adhere to the bone, then you insert all this into your body and throw it away, and you cure it.
Mays si en aquestas plaguas es arteria o vena de la qual fluxs de sanc pot evenir, e no es abscindida per medicinas, lahoras tu inquier sobre la arteria, e si atrobas aquela no-inscidida, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am spatum, o lia aquela; e si necessitat te provoca que aquo que havem dit no comfereys, lahoras tu cauteriza entro que·l sanc sia abscidit.	But if in these wounds it is an artery or vein from which blood flows and cannot be cut with medicine, then you investigate the artery, and if you find that unclosed one, then you insert that with a sponge or ligate it; and if necessity compels you not to trust what has been said, then cauterize until the wound is closed.
E si aquestas plaguas son simplas e petitas, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiere; enayssi que tu polverizas sobre aquelas aquesta polvera, quar consolidada aquela denant que l’ayre mude aquelas.	If these wounds are simple and small, then the cause of them is light; therefore, sprinkle powder over those parts that powder will settle on, and when it solidifies, it will change the air in those.
E la manieyra de la polvera es aquesta: recipe oli de enses partida una, de sanc de drago partida doas, de caus no-extincta partidas tres; sia tot mot trissat e crivellat, e de lu sia la plagua omplida, e sia constrengida per bona constriccio entro que be sobre aquela aderesca, e sia coagulada am le sanc.	And the manner of the powder is this: mix olive oil with one crushed herb, dragon's blood crushed twice, and a root that has not been extinct for three times; all mixed together, trituated and refined, so that the powder may fill and be constricted well in the wound, and coagulated by the blood.
E aprop strengeys aquela desus am pulvils e leyssa aquela, e no la deslias mentre esta ayssi que no es apostemada, quar no es eredicada de lu la medicina entro que sia sanada.	And now take those wounds and dust them off and do not remove them while they are still in that state, unless it is clear that they are an ulcer, for they are not yet cured by the medicine when they are still infected.
E alcuna vetz fa aquo sola cautz, quan no es a tu en present enses e sanc de drago.	There is none of this alone cured, when it is not in your hand to treat and to heal with dragon's ointment.
E ja fa aquesta meteyssa operacio en las grans plaguas quan conveneys que sia pausada sobre aquelas e sian streytas, e so plaguas recentz am le lor sanc, las quals le ayre no ha alteradas.	And this is done in the great operations on large wounds when it is deemed that they should be stopped and straightened, and only those recent wounds that have not had their sanctity altered.
E si le ayre las ha alteradas, e majorment quan es en temps d’estiu, lahoras no es entencio a la posicio de aquesta polvera, mays adonc cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit, enayssi que tu pauses sobre aquelas alcus enguents degistius, o que pauses sobre aquelas pols de la farina del ordi am aygua e mel entro que getan poyredura; e aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	But if the air has altered them, and more so in summer's time, then it is not understood about the position of this powder, but rather to cure those with this method, as you pause over those ulcerous spots or that pour powdered flour and water mixed with honey until they are applied.
Mays si accideys am la plagua fractura en os, e es petita, lahoras tu extratz aquo am gesti.	But if it happens that the wound fractures a bone and it is small, then you extract this from your hand.
E yeu diyre la cura de las fracturas del cap en aquo que es envenidor.	I think I can try.
De las plaguas del col.	Pain in the neck.
Mays si la plagua accideys en le col, lahoras no es en lu differencia en medicacio, e entre la plagua del cap quan es simpla.	But if the pain occurs in the neck, then it is not treated differently from a headache.
Mays si ja le nervi del col es inscis o arteria, lahoras si es nervi, no es en lu engen sino que sia evitada curacio de lu am aquo que fa vehement stipticitat, ayssi cum ziniar e zegi que es vetriol e semblantz a lor quar nozo als nervis e contrazo aquel.	But if the nerves in the neck are cut or an artery, then it is not treated as such, but rather left alone and avoided because of the violent inflammation that occurs there, just like zanthion and similar to old vetriol, which resembles its noxious effect on nerves and counteract.
E no pauses sobre la plagua alcuna causa de tot freja, quar la sustancia dels nervis es freja e la continuacio de lu es am le cervel, le qual es le pus aut de totz les membres. Mays si a la plagua es profunditat o accideys en lu a la pus bassa partida poyredura, lahoras perfora aquela en le loc mays depremegut.	The text means: But if the wound is deep or occurs in the lower part of the skin, it is necessary to pierce it at that place, more so.

Mays si la plagua ja en le os a fayta enprecio, lahoras percuireys aquela, e lahoras si en lu ha fragmentz de hos, extratz totz aquels que podes de lor; e aquo que a tu no es apparelhat, leyssa aquo entro que la plagua se poyrisca, e sia separat e la egrecio de lu sia alleujada.	But if the wound has already pierced the bone, then you pierce it, and if there are fragments of bone in it, extract all those that you can from them; and since this is not a suitable thing to do, let it heal into something until the wound dries up, and separates, and relieve its pressure.
E si la plagua es recent lahoras polveriza sobre aquela polvera la qual t’e recomtada.	If the wound is recent then sprinkle powder on that powder which I have recommended to you.
Mays si en la plagua es fayta fistula, lahoras cura aquela am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra aprop en le sieu capitol.	But if the wound has created a fistula, then cure that also with it, as its description will be mentioned in the capital.
De las plaguas del col o de semblantz quan fayta entre las spallas e es fayta am spaza o am cotel o am lansa o am semblantz.	From wounds of the neck or similar as those that occur between the shoulder blades, and are made with a space, a split, a lance, or something similar.
Si es percussio de lansa o de cotel, e vezes de lu la profunditat, lahoras considera mays si de la plagua yeys ventositat quan le malaute elena; lahoras sapias que la plagua es mortal.	If it is a lance or spear wound and repeatedly hits the depth, then considering more if the wound has airiness than the sickness causes; then knowing that the wound is mortal.
E si en lu no es profunditat e la plagua es recent am le sieu sanc, lahoras tu pauses en lu de la primieyra horo polvera, e no strenhas aquel per que no sia le sanc retengut en la profunditat de lu e que retorne al cor e que aucigua le malaute, mays pausa en lu enguent atractiu, e deslia aquela doas veguadas le dia.	If in it there is no depth and the wound is recent on its strength, then pause over it at first hour with powder, and not strain that it may not hold the sickness in the depth of it and return to the heart but pause instead over attractive juice, and remove those two times a day.
E si l’enguent no es a tu present, lahoras tu pausa en le orrifici de la plagua coto viel per que sucque aquo que yeys de las humiditatz; e fay que le malaute dorma sobre la plagua per que corra aquo que es en lu ajustat.	If the juice is not at your disposal, then pause over the orifice of the wound to suck up what there is of the humidity; and make that the sickness sleep on the wound so that what is in it is constricted.
Mays si ja de la plagua son passatz tres dias o mays e no accideys al malaute spasme ni tremor de cor mal ni strictura de ale, e vezes las autras dispozicios bonas de lu, lahoras sapias que plagua es salva; e adonc cura aquela am calguas e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanada.	When the sickness has passed for three days or more, and does not occur in spasms, tremors of the heart, or strictures of the entrails, and at other times good dispositions are observed in him, you know that the sickness is saved; and then cure it with heat and with another kind of healing until it is healed.
Mays si la sanacio de lu es excusada, e ja tot temps es uberta, lahoras sapias que ja es fayta fistula; cura donc aquela per le sieu capitol.	But if the cure of him is denied, and it has been open for all time, you know that a fistula has already been made; therefore cure him with his own capital.
E si la plagua es per inscisio de spaza o de cotel, e es simpla en la superficia del pietz o del dos, lahoras cura aquela am aquo que es precedit de sutura, si es gran, o am polvera, si es petita.	And if the sickness is due to a cut in space or in a cleft, and it is simple on the surface of the foot or the sole, then cure that with what is preceded by suture, if large, or with powder, if small.
Mays si ja ha fayta enprecio en le os, e so ja de lu inscizas pessas, lahoras tu torqua la plagua e coyta ad extrayre aquelas pessas, si so separadas.	But if there has already been an impression in the bone, and those incised pieces are from him, then you must twist the plague and cut to extract those pieces, if they are separate.
Mays si no so separadas, lahoras leyssa las entro que se poyresca la plagua, que la extraccio de lor es alleujada.	But if they are not separate, then you will lance them in order that the plague may be alleviated; for their extraction eases it.
E de las autras plaguas accidentz en les autres membres le juvament en curacio es le juvament de aquo que havem dit.	And of the other accidents that occur in other members, the remedy is the one we have already said.
De las plaguas del ventre.	Of the pains of the belly.
L’indisposicio la qual accideys en le ventre es o gran, o pauc, o migiera.	The indisposition that occurs in the belly is either great, or little, or intermittent.
De la gran alcunas veguadas yeys le budel o nervi del budel, per que es fayta intromissio de lor e la sutura de lor esser pus vehement e pus subtil.	Of the great ones some are seen in the intestine or nerve of the intestine, so that it is necessary to make an incision into them and close their opening more violently and subtly.
E disrupcio petita es fayta dificil per autra manieyra, e siec se que la reduccio de lor es pus dificil, si no te coytes de la intromissio de lor al sieu loc tantost, quar se ubre e es engrossat per que le intrament de lu es fayt difficil.	And small disruption is done more easily in another way, and it's clear that the reduction of them is harder if you don't penetrate their place soon, for they become swollen and it becomes difficult to perform their insertion.
E donc la milhor disrupcio es migiera, quar en aquela no es dificil la reduccio del budel, ayssi cum es dificil en las doas specias denant ditas.	And therefore the best disruption is intermittent, because in that case it's not difficult to reduce the intestine, as it is in the two other specified cases.
E sapias que sutura del ventre es segon quatre manieyras, mays doas suturas son comunas que conveneysso en suturas de las autras plaguas del cors.	And it is known that the wound of the belly is performed in four ways, but two are common and suit for the wounds of other parts of the body.
E duas autras suturas proprias comunican a las autras plaguas, mays empero so mays proprias en la sutura del ventre.	And two other stitches are communicating with the other wounds, but they are more proper in the belly stitch.
E yeu recomti a tu quascuna am exposicio e declaracio.	I recommend to each and every one of you an exposition and declaration.
Donc dic que quan la plagua es petita e es eyssit alcuna causa del budel per aquela, e es fayt dificil a reduzir aquel, lahoras aquo es en una de doas manieyras: o per parvitat de la disrupcio ayssi cum havem dit, o quan al budel es venguda inflacio per la frigiditat de l’ayre. E si envezeys aquel, lahoras inscideys le bras entro al coyde en la junctura.	If instead you insert that into the elbow, then you put the arm into the joint.
E si passa otra la corrupcio e la vezes enviro le coyde, lahoras en aquel es la mort del malaute; e aministrar autra causa otra aquo en curacio es quantitat de vertut.	And if there is more corruption and it enters the vein again, then that is the death of the disease; and administering another cause or cure over here in healing is the quantity of virtue.
E semblantment fay del pe quan corrupcio envezeys le dit del pe, lahoras tu inscideys aquel entro ad un dels nozes.	And similarly do of the foot when corruption enters instead of the sole, then you insert that into one of the nails.
E si pren en la pente del pe, lahoras tu inscideys tot le pe.	And if it enters the heel of the foot, then you insert all the foot.
Mays si pueja entro al denol, lahoras tu inscideys la camba entro a la junctura del denol.	But if it penetrates the heel bone, then you insert the chamber into the joint of the heel.
E si la corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denol, lahoras en lu no es engen sino dimissio, e layssar le malaute a la mort.	And if the corruption is already spread over the heel bone, then it is not to be engaged but dismissal, and leave the disease to death.
E la manieyra de inscidir le membre o de serrar lu es que tu strenhas le liament en la partida pus dejos la qual voles inscidir, e strenh autre liament sobre le loc; e extenda le ministre un liament a las partidas dejos, e extenda le ministra autra liament en sus; e tu separa la carn la qual es entre dos liamentz ain spatum lat entro que sia descuberta tota la carn; e aprop sia inscidit o serrat.	When joint pain is caused by cold humors that infiltrate each part of the body, and pain occurs in the feet, it is customarily called gout by doctors.
E cove que sia pausat drap de li de totas partidas per so que no toque le loc sa, e que vengua al malaute lesio ajustada e apostema caut. The text means: But if blood flows from the wound when working, then either cauterize the place immediately, or pause over it some powder that restrains the flow; and return to your medicine until it is completed.

Lonc temps accidic a lu aquela meteyssa corrupcio en le dit de la ma indic.	Long time ago, that corruption in the middle of the hand came to be known in the said book.
E adonc venc a mi, e so me perforsat repercutir aquela superfluitat am aquo que pausegui sobre la ma de las medicinas, aprop la mundificacio del cos de lu; e no es repercussa la superfluitat e comensec anar al autra dit entro que comensec en la ma. De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.	Of the treatment of joints and quality of the clusterization with medicine.
Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula.	Joint pain caused by cold humors that infiltrate each part of the body and lead to an accumulation of pus, which is then ruptured and perforated, and the pus is drained out. The space remains empty as if it were a vessel, and the membrane covering it is gently wrapped around the wound, and no further corruption occurs, nor does it infect the bone or nerves or ligament. This is called sinu.
Mays empero si le spazi es prolonguat entro que la corrupcio enprema en alcun membre, lahoras es appelada fistula e no zukem.	However, if the space is prolonged within which corruption sets in on some member, then it is called a fistula and does not seem.

The cure for it is to tie that membrane tightly around as it is rolled up, and more so when it is gently wrapped with a cloth, and comforts are provided so that they do not stick to the place due to its corruption.
Mays si tu speras que la codena adheresca e que aquela corrupcio no aja conseguit per deriera consecucio, e en la codena ha spassitut de cara, lahoras tu cura aquel am clisteri. And this is because the sinu is considered, and when it is large, and the arm that is swollen has a fetid odor, then plastering that area with an Egyptian medicine, which consists of oil, vinegar, and zinc oxide, is applied. And then you take from him what is necessary and dissolve it with water and honey; and tie up the wound, and strengthen the orifice of it, and soothe the medicine in him for two hours.

And sometimes it is clisterized with water of ash, when this medicine is not available to you; and because you take the ash of vitreous, and place it on the water; and tie up that one with it inside until you confess that the sinus has healed.

If the illness does not tolerate the Egyptian medicine or the water of ash, then clisterize that one with water and honey and mix it three times a day; and clisterize that one with white (vitreous) and honey mixed, because the property of honey is that it cleanses and heals, and the vitreous adheres to the sinus, and more so when in the vitreous there is an excess of inflammation and dryness.

De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione.	The treatment of horn or nail injuries caused by a cut finger and sectioning.

The horn or nail injury which sends an appendix to the tip of the finger or toe, and is less painful in other places, as it prolongs and its treatment is more prolonged, or is an appostema caut, or corrupted, where force is applied to throw the appendix into the root of the nail, and strongly corrupts that entire area, and strongly leads to corruption into the bone, which makes a foul odor, and causes the injury to become black.

De inscizio de vices, so son varicas.	From the beginning of vices, which are varicose veins.
Vices so son varicas, e so venas envolutas grossas plenas de superfluitatz melencolicas las quals veno en motz dels membres del cors, e le major adveniment de lor en las cambas, e majorment en las cambas dels itinerantz e dels laborantz e dels portantz.	Vices are varicose veins, which are twisted and swollen veins filled with superfluous melancholic matter that comes out in the limbs of the body, and the greatest occurrence is in the groin, and especially in the groin of travelers and laborers.
